code: @Manual{,   title = {lnmixsurv: Bayesian Mixture Log-Normal Survival Model},   author = {{Viviana das Graças Ribeiro Lobo} and {Thaís Cristina Oliveira da Fonseca} and {Mariane Branco Alves} and {Vitor Capdeville}},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 3.1.2},   url = {https://vivianalobo.github.io/lnmixsurv/}, }

title: Bayesian Mixture Log-Normal Survival Model
text: lnmixsurv package provides easy interface Bayesian lognormal mixture model proposed Lobo, Fonseca Alves, 2023. usual formula-type model implemented survival_ln_mixture, usual suvival::Surv() interface. model tries follow conventions R modeling packages, uses hardhat structure. underlying algorithm implementation Gibbs sampler takes initial values small run EM-Algorithm, initial values selection based log-likelihood. Besides Bayesian approach, Expectation-Maximization approach (focus maximizing likelihood) censored data also available. methods implemented C++ using RcppArmadillo linear algebra operations, RcppGSL random number generation seed control RcppParallel (since version 3.0.0) parallelization.

title: Bayesian Mixture Log-Normal Survival Model
text: dependency GSL, , make sure GSL installed proceeding , basic guides install operational system Windows (Windows users probably fine ready go).

title: Bayesian Mixture Log-Normal Survival Model
text: Run brew install gsl console/terminal enough installing GSL.

title: Bayesian Mixture Log-Normal Survival Model
text: installation GSL Linux distro-specific. main distros -: Arch: sudo pacman -S gsl CentOS/RHEL: sudo yum install gsl-devel sudo dnf install gsl-devel (make sure EPEL – Extra Packages Enterprise Linux – repository enabled) Debian/Ubuntu: sudo apt-get install libgsl-dev Fedora: sudo dnf install gsl-devel Gentoo: sudo emerge sci-libs/gsl openSUSE: sudo zypper install gsl-devel

title: Bayesian Mixture Log-Normal Survival Model
text: can install latest development version lnmixsurv GitHub: Alternatively, install latest development version lnmixsurv, can use following code:
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("vivianalobo/lnmixsurv") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("vivianalobo/lnmixsurv", "devel")

what: lnmixsurv: Bayesian Mixture Log-Normal Survival Model — lnmixsurv-package
title: lnmixsurv: Bayesian Mixture Log-Normal Survival Model — lnmixsurv-package
text: Bayesian Survival models via mixture Log-Normal distribution extends well-known survival models accommodates different behaviour time considers higher censored survival times. proposal combines mixture distributions Fruhwirth-Schnatter(2006) doi:10.1007/s11336-009-9121-4 , data augmentation techniques Tanner Wong (1987) doi:10.1080/01621459.1987.10478458 .

title: Function used to quick visualize the fitted values (survival estimate) on the data used to fit the model (via EM algorithm or Gibbs). — plot_fit_on_data
text: model survival_ln_mixture survival_ln_mixture_em object. data data.frame() tibble() containing data used fit model. appropriate behavior, object used generate survival_ln_mixture/survival_ln_mixture_em objects. type character string specifying type plot. default "survival", can "hazard". interval character string specifying type interval plotted. default "none", can "credible". EM algorithm provide confidence intervals parameter support Bayesian version (survival_ln_mixture object). level numeric value 0 1 specifying level confidence interval. default 0.95.

Valid options : "time" survival time. implmeented "survival" survival probability. "hazard" hazard. eval_time type = "hazard" type = "survival", times distribution. interval interval estimates added? Options "none" "credible". level tail area intervals. Default value 0.95. ... used, required extensibility.

text: tibble predictions. number rows tibble guaranteed number rows new_data.

title: Predict from a Lognormal Mixture Model — predict.survival_ln_mixture
text: Categorical predictors must converted factors fit, otherwise predictions fail.

title: Predict from a Lognormal Mixture Model — predict.survival_ln_mixture
code: # Categorical variables must be converted to factor before the fit. require(survival) set.seed(1) mod <- survival_ln_mixture(Surv(time, status == 2) ~ factor(sex), lung, intercept = TRUE) # Would result in error if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ predict(mod, data.frame(sex = 1), type = "survival", eval_time = 100) } # }  # Correct way lung$sex <- factor(lung$sex) set.seed(1) mod2 <- survival_ln_mixture(Surv(time, status == 2) ~ sex, lung, intercept = TRUE) # Note: the categorical predictors must be character. predict(mod2, data.frame(sex = "1"), type = "survival", eval_time = 100) #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   .pred            strata #>   <list>           <fct>  #> 1 <tibble [1 × 2]> sex=1

title: Function to simulate survival data from a mixture of normal distribution. — simulate_data

title: Function to simulate survival data from a mixture of normal distribution. — simulate_data
text: n Number observations desired. mixture_components Number mixtures include generation data. k number covariates generated (total covariates intercept + (k - 1) covariates). percentage_censored Percentage censored observations (defined decimal value 0 1). generate delta vector 1 event ocurred 0 censored observation. starting_seed Seed start random number generation.

what: Lognormal mixture model - Gibbs sampler — survival_ln_mixture
title: Lognormal mixture model - Gibbs sampler — survival_ln_mixture
text: survival_ln_mixture() fits Bayesian lognormal mixture model Gibbs sampling (optional EM algorithm find local maximum likelihood function), described LOBO, Viviana GR; FONSECA, Thaís CO; ALVES, Mariane B. Lapse risk modeling insurance: Bayesian mixture approach. Annals Actuarial Science, v. 18, n. 1, p. 126-151, 2024.

title: Lognormal mixture model - Gibbs sampler — survival_ln_mixture
code: survival_ln_mixture(   formula,   data,   intercept = TRUE,   iter = 1000,   warmup = floor(iter/10),   thin = 1,   chains = 1,   cores = 1,   mixture_components = 2,   show_progress = FALSE,   em_iter = 0,   starting_seed = sample(1:2^28, 1),   use_W = FALSE,   number_em_search = 200,   iteration_em_search = 1,   fast_groups = TRUE,   ... )  # Default S3 method survival_ln_mixture(formula, ...)  # S3 method for class 'formula' survival_ln_mixture(formula, data, intercept = TRUE, ...)

title: Lognormal mixture model - Gibbs sampler — survival_ln_mixture
text: formula formula specifying outcome terms left-hand side, predictor terms right-hand side. outcome must survival::Surv object. data data frame containing predictors outcome. intercept logical. intercept included processed data? iter positive integer specifying number iterations chain (including warmup). warmup positive integer specifying number warmup (aka burnin) iterations per chain. number warmup iterations smaller iter. thin positive integer specifying period saving samples. chains positive integer specifying number Markov chains. cores positive integer specifying maximum number cores run chains. Setting value bigger 1 automatically trigger parallel mode mixture_components number mixture componentes >= 2. show_progress Indicates code shows progress EM algorithm Gibbs Sampler. em_iter positive integer specifying number iterations EM algorithm. EM algorithm performed Gibbs sampler find better initial values chains. simulations, values lower 200 seems work nice. starting_seed Starting seed sampler. specified user, uses random integer 1 2^28 way ensure, user sets seed R, passed C++ code. use_W Specifies W (groups weight's matrix observation) used EM. holds W constant code, resulting faster Bayesian Inference (close Empirical Bayes ). may helps generating credible intervals survival hazard curves, using information previous EM iteration. Make sure EM converged setting parameter true. doubt, leave FALSE, default. number_em_search Number different EM's search maximum likelihoods. Recommended leave, least, 100. value can set 0 disable search maximum likelihood initial values. iteration_em_search Number iterations EM's used find maximum likelihoods. Recommended leave small values, 1 5. fast_groups Use fast computation groups allocations probabilities, defaults TRUE. Setting FALSE can increase computation time (lot) worth trying chains converging. ... currently used, required extensibility.

title: Lognormal mixture model - Gibbs sampler — survival_ln_mixture
text: survival_ln_mixture object, list following componentes: posterior posterior::draws_matrix posterior parameters model. nobs integer holding number observations used generate fit. blueprint blueprint component output hardhat::mold

title: Lognormal mixture model - Gibbs sampler — survival_ln_mixture
text: Categorical predictors must converted factors fit, otherwise predictions fail.

title: Lognormal mixture model - Gibbs sampler — survival_ln_mixture
code: # Formula interface library(survival) set.seed(1) mod <- survival_ln_mixture(Surv(time, status == 2) ~ NULL, lung, intercept = TRUE)

what: Lognormal mixture model - Expectation-Maximization Algorithm — survival_ln_mixture_em
title: Lognormal mixture model - Expectation-Maximization Algorithm — survival_ln_mixture_em
text: survival_ln_mixture_em() fits EM algorithm, described LOBO, Viviana GR; FONSECA, Thaís CO; ALVES, Mariane B. Lapse risk modeling insurance: Bayesian mixture approach. Annals Actuarial Science, v. 18, n. 1, p. 126-151, 2024, modelling mixtures lognormal distributions applied survival data.

title: Lognormal mixture model - Expectation-Maximization Algorithm — survival_ln_mixture_em
code: survival_ln_mixture_em(   formula,   data,   intercept = TRUE,   iter = 50,   mixture_components = 2,   starting_seed = sample(1:2^28, 1),   number_em_search = 200,   iteration_em_search = 1,   show_progress = FALSE,   ... )  # Default S3 method survival_ln_mixture_em(formula, ...)  # S3 method for class 'formula' survival_ln_mixture_em(formula, data, intercept = TRUE, ...)

title: Lognormal mixture model - Expectation-Maximization Algorithm — survival_ln_mixture_em
text: formula formula specifying outcome terms left-hand side, predictor terms right-hand side. outcome must survival::Surv object. data data frame containing predictors outcome. intercept logical. intercept included processed data? iter positive integer specifying number iterations EM algorithm. mixture_components number mixture componentes >= 2. starting_seed Starting seed algorithm. specified user, uses random integer 1 2^28 way ensure, user sets seed R, passed C++ code. number_em_search Number different EM's search maximum likelihoods. Recommended leave, least, 100. iteration_em_search Number iterations EM's used find maximum likelihoods. Recommended leave small values, 1 5. show_progress logical. progress EM algorithm shown? ... currently used, required extensibility.

what: Tidying method for a Lognormal Mixture model. — tidy.survival_ln_mixture
title: Tidying method for a Lognormal Mixture model. — tidy.survival_ln_mixture
text: method tidy estimates survival_ln_mixture fits summary.

title: Tidying method for a Lognormal Mixture model. — tidy.survival_ln_mixture
code: # S3 method for class 'survival_ln_mixture' tidy(   x,   effects = "fixed",   conf.int = FALSE,   conf.level = 0.9,   digits = NULL,   ... )

title: Tidying method for a Lognormal Mixture model. — tidy.survival_ln_mixture
text: x Fitted model object (survival_ln_mixture). effects character vector including one "fixed" "auxiliary. conf.int TRUE columns lower (cred.low) upper (cred.high) bounds posterior uncertainty intervals included. conf.level number 0 1 indicating desired probability mass include intervals. used conf.int = TRUE. digits many significant digits displayed? ... used.

title: Tidying method for a Lognormal Mixture model. — tidy.survival_ln_mixture
text: data.frame without rownames. effects="fixed" (default), tidy.survival_ln_mixutre returns one row coefficient component mixture three columns: term name corresponding term model. estimate point estimate coefficient (posterior median). std.error standard error point estimate based mad. See Uncertainty estimates section print.stanreg details. Setting effects="auxiliary" select precision proportion mixture components parameters.

title: Tidying method for a Lognormal Mixture model. — tidy.survival_ln_mixture
code: require(survival) lung$sex <- factor(lung$sex) set.seed(1) mod2 <- survival_ln_mixture(Surv(time, status == 2) ~ sex, lung) tidy(mod2) #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   term          estimate std.error #>   <chr>            <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1 (Intercept)_1    5.76      0.108 #> 2 sex2_1           0.314     0.181 #> 3 (Intercept)_2    5.04      0.225 #> 4 sex2_2           0.822     0.345 tidy(mod2, conf.int = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 4 × 5 #>   term          estimate std.error cred.low cred.high #>   <chr>            <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1 (Intercept)_1    5.76      0.108   5.62       5.91  #> 2 sex2_1           0.314     0.181   0.0556     0.537 #> 3 (Intercept)_2    5.04      0.225   4.76       5.34  #> 4 sex2_2           0.822     0.345   0.396      1.28  tidy(mod2, effects = c("fixed", "auxiliary"), conf.int = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 7 × 5 #>   term          estimate std.error cred.low cred.high #>   <chr>            <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1 (Intercept)_1    5.76     0.108    5.62       5.91  #> 2 sex2_1           0.314    0.181    0.0556     0.537 #> 3 (Intercept)_2    5.04     0.225    4.76       5.34  #> 4 sex2_2           0.822    0.345    0.396      1.28  #> 5 phi_1            3.01     0.746    2.20       4.06  #> 6 phi_2            0.550    0.115    0.425      0.706 #> 7 eta_1            0.512    0.0308   0.475      0.549

text: method tidy estimates survival_ln_mixture fits short summary. contain uncertainty estimates since likelihood maximization algorithm.

code: # S3 method for class 'survival_ln_mixture_em' tidy(x, effects = "fixed", digits = NULL, ...)

title: Tidying method for a Lognormal Mixture model (fitted via Expectation-Maximization algorithm). — tidy.survival_ln_mixture_em
text: x Fitted model object (survival_ln_mixture_em). effects character vector including one "fixed" "auxiliary. digits many significant digits displayed? ... used.

title: Tidying method for a Lognormal Mixture model (fitted via Expectation-Maximization algorithm). — tidy.survival_ln_mixture_em
text: data.frame without rownames. effects="fixed" (default), tidy.survival_ln_mixutre returns one row coefficient component mixture two columns: term name corresponding term model. estimate point estimate coefficient (last iteration value). Setting effects="auxiliary" select precision proportion mixture components parameters.

title: Tidying method for a Lognormal Mixture model (fitted via Expectation-Maximization algorithm). — tidy.survival_ln_mixture_em
code: require(survival) lung$sex <- factor(lung$sex) set.seed(1) mod2 <- survival_ln_mixture_em(Surv(time, status == 2) ~ sex, lung) tidy(mod2) #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   term          estimate #>   <chr>            <dbl> #> 1 (Intercept)_1    2.48  #> 2 sex2_1          -0.875 #> 3 (Intercept)_2    5.45  #> 4 sex2_2           0.571 tidy(mod2, effects = c("fixed", "auxiliary")) #> # A tibble: 8 × 2 #>   term           estimate #>   <chr>             <dbl> #> 1 (Intercept)_1  2.48e+ 0 #> 2 sex2_1        -8.75e- 1 #> 3 (Intercept)_2  5.45e+ 0 #> 4 sex2_2         5.71e- 1 #> 5 phi_1          7.59e- 1 #> 6 phi_2          8.72e- 1 #> 7 eta_1          1.19e-18 #> 8 eta_2          1   e+ 0
